Maintenance & Troubleshooting

This section provides guidelines for regular maintenance, troubleshooting, and resolving common issues in the CLAS project.

Regular Maintenance

To ensure smooth operation, it's important to perform regular maintenance tasks:

  • Check for software updates regularly. Run the following command to pull the latest changes:
    • git pull origin main
  • Update dependencies by running:
    • pip install -r requirements.txt --upgrade
  • Review logs for any unusual activities or errors. Logs are stored in the /logs directory.

Common Issues and Solutions

Issue: Application not starting
Ensure all dependencies are installed. Run pip install -r requirements.txt and try again. If the issue persists, check the logs for more details.
Issue: Missing module error
Verify that all required modules are listed in requirements.txt and install them using pip install.
Issue: Configuration errors
Double-check the config.yaml file for any incorrect or missing values. Refer to the Configuration Guide for more information.
Issue: Performance issues with large datasets
Consider optimizing the data processing pipeline or increasing available system resources. For large-scale operations, try running in a distributed environment.

Contributing

If you would like to contribute to the CLAS project, please follow the guidelines below:

Code Standards

  • Follow the PEP 8 Python style guide for all contributions.
  • Write clear, concise, and well-commented code.
  • Ensure all functions and classes are documented properly with docstrings.

Submitting Code

To contribute code to CLAS, follow these steps:

  1. Fork the repository and clone it to your local machine.
  2. Create a new branch for your feature or fix:
    3. git checkout -b feature-branch
  3. Make your changes, commit them with descriptive messages:
    4. git commit -m "Add new feature"
  4. Push your changes to your fork:
    5. git push origin feature-branch
  5. Open a pull request on GitHub to submit your changes for review.

Code Reviews

All contributions will undergo a code review process. Once your pull request is reviewed and approved, it will be merged into the main branch.
